intro: Epilobium subcaesium, commonly known as narrowleaf willow herb, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist, often disturbed habitats such as wet meadows and riverbanks. The plant features slender, often hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are usually less than 5 cm in length. Its flowers are small, clustered in spikes, and have four petals, typically pink or reddish in color. Epilobium subcaesium is often found in wetland environments and can be an indicator species for nutrient-rich soils.
